speaker: Agent
text: NovaNet customer care, this is Meera. How can I help today?

speaker: Customer
text: Cancel my internet. You people increased the price again.

speaker: Agent
text: I can help with cancellation. Before I proceed, I’m required to confirm account details and also explain any final billing and equipment return steps. Can I have your name and service address?

speaker: Customer
text: Rahul Sharma, 9th Floor, Orion Towers, Mumbai.

speaker: Agent
text: Thanks, Rahul. One more security check—registered phone number or last invoice amount?

speaker: Customer
text: Phone number 99xxxx7721.

speaker: Agent
text: Got it. Pulling your account up now…

speaker: Agent
text: Okay, I see you’re on Fiber 200 with monthly _2,199. There was a rate adjustment this month to _2,349. Is that the increase you’re referring to?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes. And last year also it went up. I’m done.

speaker: Agent
text: Totally understand. Before we cancel, can I ask one thing—are you switching to another provider, or is this because you don’t need the service anymore? It helps me pick the correct cancellation type and avoid surprises like early termination fees.

speaker: Customer
text: I’m switching. Another provider is giving the same plan cheaper.

speaker: Agent
text: Fair. Quick check: you’re not under a contract right now, so no early termination fee. The only remaining item would be returning NovaNet equipment—your router and ONT—within 7 days to avoid non-return charges.

speaker: Customer
text: I have a router, yes. How do I return it?

speaker: Agent
text: Two options: free pickup appointment, or drop-off at a partner store. Pickup is easiest—courier comes, scans the device, and you get an SMS receipt. Would you prefer pickup?

speaker: Customer
text: Pickup. I’m not going anywhere.

speaker: Agent
text: Done. I’ll schedule. Now, cancellation date: do you want to cancel immediately today, or at the end of your billing cycle? Immediate cancellation may create prorated final charges or credits depending on usage and policy.

speaker: Customer
text: Cancel immediately. Today.

speaker: Agent
text: Understood. I’ll process same-day termination. Note: service may stop within 2 hours. Your final bill will include charges up to today and any remaining balance, minus any prorated credit. It usually generates within 48 hours.

speaker: Customer
text: Fine.

speaker: Agent
text: Before I finalize, I’m allowed to check if any retention offer can match your new provider. No pressure—just giving you the option. I can apply a _300 monthly loyalty credit for 6 months, bringing your plan to roughly _2,049 before tax. Would that change your mind?

speaker: Customer
text: No. I already booked the other connection.

speaker: Agent
text: Got it. Respect. Let’s cancel cleanly then. I’m going to read a short confirmation statement: By requesting disconnection, you authorize NovaNet to terminate services and issue a final bill. Do you confirm you want to proceed?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes.

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you. Processing cancellation now…

speaker: Agent
text: Okay, it’s submitted. Cancellation request number is CAN-539201. Your service will end today, February 2, by 6 PM.

speaker: Customer
text: And pickup?

speaker: Agent
text: Scheduling equipment pickup: earliest slot is tomorrow 10 AM to 1 PM, or Wednesday 2 PM to 6 PM. I’m booking tomorrow 10 to 1 unless that doesn’t work.

speaker: Customer
text: Tomorrow is fine.

speaker: Agent
text: Booked. You’ll get an SMS with tracking. Please keep the router, ONT, and power adapters together. Missing adapters can trigger a partial fee, which is annoying and avoidable.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay.

speaker: Agent
text: Final bill: it will be emailed and also visible in the app. If you’re on AutoPay, I recommend disabling it after the final bill is paid to avoid confusion—though AutoPay will only process billed amounts.

speaker: Customer
text: Alright.

speaker: Agent
text: Anything else while I have you? Like updating your email for the final statement if you’re changing providers?

speaker: Customer
text: No, that’s fine.

speaker: Agent
text: Understood. Thanks for being direct—makes my life easier. Sorry we couldn’t keep you this time. Take care.
